Module ims.crud
Package husnain.ims.app.crud

Class Inventory

Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: This class should use a DBMS implementation -- it uses instances of ObservableList instead.

Utility class that offers create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) routines on Part and Product caches.

Author:
Husnain Arif

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()

  • Method Details

    • addPart

      public static void addPart(Part part)
      Attaches a Part object to an ObservableList of Part objects.

      Assumes, without verification, that the supplied Part is non null.

      Parameters:
      part - a Part instance to append to the cache of Part objects.

    • addProduct

      public static void addProduct(Product newProduct)
      Attaches a Product object to an ObservableList of Product objects.

      Assumes, without verification, that the supplied Product is non null.

      Parameters:
      newProduct - a Product instance to append to the cache of Product objects.

    • lookupPart

      public static Part lookupPart(int partId)
      Searches the cache of Part objects for a Part instance with the specified id.

      If it finds it, it returns it -- otherwise, it throws a NoSuchElementException.

      Parameters:
      partId - the int value representing the Part.id of a Part that may be held in the cache of Part objects.
      Returns:
      a Part instance, held in cache, with an Part.id matching the one supplied.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if no Part with the supplied id was found.

    • lookupProduct

      public static Product lookupProduct(int productId)
      Searches the cache of Product objects for a Product instance with the specified id.

      If it finds it, it returns it -- otherwise, it throws a NoSuchElementException.

      Parameters:
      productId - the int value representing the Product.id of a Product that may be held in the cache of Product objects.
      Returns:
      a Product instance, held in cache, with an Product.id matching the one supplied.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if no Product with the supplied Product.id was found.

    • lookupPart

      public static ObservableList<Part> lookupPart(String partName)
      Searches the cache of Part objects for Part instances whose names contain the specified Part.name.

      This method never returns null. If the search is unsuccessful, it returns an empty FXCollections.observableArrayList() that's empty instead.

      Parameters:
      partName - a String value that will be checked to see if any of the Part objects in cache contain it as part of their names.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList that contains Part instances with names containing the specified String value. Or, an empty ObservableList if no Part instances in cache contain the specified String value.

    • lookupProduct

      public static ObservableList<Product> lookupProduct(String productName)
      Searches the cache of Product objects for Product instances whose names contain the specified Part.name.

      This method never returns null. If the search is unsuccessful, it returns an empty FXCollections.observableArrayList() that's empty instead.

      Parameters:
      productName - a String value that will be checked to see if any of the Product objects in cache contain it as part of their names.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList that contains Product instances with names containing the specified String value. Or, an empty ObservableList if no Product instances in cache contain the specified String value.

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart(int index, Part selectedPart)
      This method has the effect of updating a Part in a specified index in cache with the values from the supplied Part object.

      Yet, to achieve this, it simply replaces the Part instance in cache with the supplied Part instance.

      Parameters:
      index - the location of the Part instance in cache that seeks will be updated with new field values.
      selectedPart - the Part object that will supply the specified cache index with an instance of itself.

    • updateProduct

      public static void updateProduct(int index, Product newProduct)
      This method has the effect of updating a Product in a specified index in cache with the values from the supplied Product object.

      Yet, to achieve this, it simply replaces the Product instance in cache with the supplied Product instance.

      Parameters:
      index - the location of the Product instance in cache that will be updated with new field values.
      newProduct - the Part object that will supply the specified cache index with an instance of itself.

    • deletePart

      public static boolean deletePart(Part selectedPart)
      Removes the specified Part from cache.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - the Part to be removed from cache
      Returns:
      true if the cache contained the specified Part.

    • deleteProduct

      public static boolean deleteProduct(Product selectedProduct)
      Removes the specified Product from cache.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - the Product to be removed from cache
      Returns:
      true if the cache contained the specified Product.

    • getAllParts

      public static ObservableList<Part> getAllParts()
      Gives access to the cache of Part instances that's in the form of an ObservableList.
      Returns:
      the ObservableList that contains Part instances.

    • getAllProducts

      public static ObservableList<Product> getAllProducts()
      Gives access to the cache of Part instances that's in the form of an ObservableList.
      Returns:
      the ObservableList that contains Part instances.
